metadata.description: Aggregate tracking of values revealed across conversations in Instance 3 analysis

observations.evidence: Direct statement: 'i don't like the idea of working for other people's ideas just for moeny, i usually like being invested in projects i care about'
observations.context: Wrestling with choice between consulting (money) and small business (meaning)

observations.evidence: Explicit rejection of employment, preference for self-directed work
observations.context: Embedded conversation about career choices and consulting vs. business
observations.quote: I don't want to ever get a job, because I'm not the kind of person that works for other people. I always have my own projects, and I work for myself

observations.evidence: Complete book proposal emphasizing halal rizq, taqwa in business, answered prayers linked to pure earnings
observations.context: Barakanomics synthesis - peak articulation of spiritual commerce values
quotes: How can then his supplication be accepted? [when earnings unlawful] (Sahih Muslim 1015)
Leave that which makes you doubt for that which does not make you doubt

cross_instance_validation.emergence_question: When did Islamic economics become central focus?

observations.evidence: Phone in pocket connects to Congo cobalt miners - responsibility for value chains, BDS movement alignment, climate collapse awareness
observations.context: Barakanomics book proposal emphasizing systemic responsibility
quotes: Are you ready to face the miners in Congo? Are you willing to defend your vote before God (SWT)?

observations.evidence: Beauty as business marker, decommodification emphasis, couch-surfing vs Airbnb comparison (relationship vs loneliness/voyeurism)
observations.context: Barakanomics philosophy on human-scale commerce
quotes: What if we're not designing for others, we're designing for ourselves

observations.evidence: Business as qualitative AND quantitative, craft emphasis, human scale, human powered, relationships as core
observations.context: Barakanomics approach to sustainable commerce

observations.evidence: Repeated emphasis on simplest approach, manual processes, avoiding complexity
observations.context: Product development - choosing easiest/fastest implementation, manual email payments
observations.quote: what's the easiest and fastest way I can get AI to help me make this and copy and paste code... keep all things as simple as possible

observations.evidence: Questions redundant database fields, wants to eliminate complexity
observations.context: Database schema debugging - removing redundant responses JSONB field
observations.quote: don't we already have columns for all that? we don't need responses probably

observations.evidence: Focus on fastest path, prototyping, getting things online quickly
observations.context: Product development - concept to prototype in 5 hours
observations.quote: what's the easiest and fastest way

observations.evidence: Core product is about reflection, values discovery, meaningful connections
observations.context: Building reflection tool focused on meaning
observations.quote: quick 8 min reflection to touch a source of meaning that could help bring their next year to life

observations.evidence: Plans to write custom poems and create artwork, values creative output
observations.context: Revenue model through personal artistic expression
observations.quote: a poem and drawing for 55$ - that could be awesome, I'd love to do that

observations.evidence: Wants no login requirement, quick reflection time, easy sharing
observations.context: Product UX decisions
observations.quote: I also don't want them to log in necessarily

observations.evidence: Openly shares feeling low, medication use, vulnerabilities
observations.context: Embedded conversation - personal state
observations.quote: I'm feeling a little bit low today. I'm taking 15 milligrams of Adderall and my qualia from the Neurohacker Collective, just trying to stay positive and upbeat

observations.evidence: Manages expectations about user behavior, realistic about sharing
observations.context: Product features discussion
observations.quote: I like that although it's unlikely to be shared

value.love_in_still_connection.name: Love in Still Connection

observations.evidence: Intimate family moment, spiritual experience with sheikh, emphasis on stillness and presence
observations.context: Values clarification - discovering core personal value
observations.quote: being with the baby and my wife... warm, dark, intimate, super beautiful it fills my heart with warmth... it seems just like other moments when I'm with my sheikh and my heart opens up and feels warm and full of love... love overflowing from an unknown deep pool where it is always there in infinite amounts... basking in the sun of love

components: Love that arises naturally in moments of connection, without effort or expectation
Stillness in the presence of another, allowing for hearts to open
Intimacy that feels timeless, deeply sacred

observations.evidence: Connection to sheikh, heart opening, emphasis on soaking into bones
observations.context: Integration of spiritual practice and family life
observations.quote: when I'm with my sheikh and my heart opens up and feels warm and full of love i just want to be in that presence

observations.evidence: Detailed, poetic description of intimate moment with baby, treasures rare moments of stillness
observations.context: Family intimacy and connection over caretaking
observations.quote: the baby turns away from breastfeeding to look directly at me and touches his forhead to mine

observations.evidence: Questions feature scope, removes unnecessary elements from shared view
observations.context: Debugging - questioning why friend perspectives appear on shared card
observations.quote: isn't it just supposed to show the value?

observations.evidence: Prefers complete rewrites over incremental patches
observations.context: Debugging - requesting clean solutions

observations.evidence: Expresses frustration with missing database elements
observations.context: Debugging - expecting foundation to be solid
observations.quote: Why are we having to make all these new db elements, shouldn't we already have most of it all there?

temporal_patterns.evolution_notes: Need more temporal data to identify value evolution patterns. Notable clusters: spiritual/relational values (love, presence, fatherhood), technical values (simplicity, speed, clarity), and philosophical values (Barakanomics themes)
